result.execSummary:
The defendant William D Diedrich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge is waived.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Submit to random U.A.'s.   
Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No drug paraphernalia. 
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
No violent contact with own children.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.
Huber/Straight Time to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant William D Diedrich in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. (Note: Case called at 1:15 p.m. from the morning calendar). Amended Information filed. Reading waived.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 and Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 6 months jail straight time STAYED for 1 year Probation - concurrent to Ct. 2
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge is waived
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. No violent contact with his children. 
-  5 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion. 

Ct. 2:
- 6 months jail straight time STAYED for 1 year Probation - concurrent to Ct. 1 
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge is waived
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. No violent contact with his children.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant William D Diedrich in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a plea/sentencing date in 2 weeks. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Treatment letter filed.
Hearing on June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William D Diedrich in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense states they will eventually have a resolution. Defendant is in treatment. Defense requests a date in 30 days. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on May 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant William D Diedrich in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense states his client is undergoing counseling and requests a date in 60 days for status. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on March 11, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant William D Diedrich in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant William D Diedrich in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the victim/witness listed in the complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol when he is around his children.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant William D Diedrich in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Attorney appears as friend of the court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.
